app package¶

Submodules¶

app.main module¶

async app.main.charge_wallet(customer_id: str, amount: float = Body(PydanticUndefined))¶

Charges a customer’s wallet by a specified amount.

Parameters:

  • customer_id (str) – The ID of the customer whose wallet to charge.

  • amount (float) – The amount to add to the wallet. Must be non-negative.

Returns:

Response object containing new wallet balance or error.

Return type:

WalletChargeResponse

async app.main.deduct_wallet(customer_id: str, amount: float = Body(PydanticUndefined))¶

Deducts a specified amount from a customer’s wallet.

Parameters:

  • customer_id (str) – The ID of the customer whose wallet to deduct from.

  • amount (float) – The amount to deduct from the wallet. Must be non-negative.

Returns:

Response object containing new wallet balance or error.

Return type:

WalletDeductResponse

async app.main.delete_customer(customer_id: str)¶

Deletes a customer by their ID.

Parameters:

customer_id (str) – The ID of the customer to delete.

Returns:

Response object containing deletion status.

Return type:

CustomerDeleteResponse

async app.main.get_all_customers()¶

Retrieves all customers from the database.

Returns:

JSON object containing all customers or an error message.

Return type:

JSONResponse

async app.main.get_customer(customer_id: str)¶

Retrieves a customer’s details by their ID.

Parameters:

customer_id (str) – The ID of the customer to retrieve.

Returns:

Response object containing customer details and wallet info.

Return type:

CustomerGetResponse

async app.main.health_check()¶

Health check endpoint to verify the service is operational.

Returns:

A simple status message.

Return type:

dict

async app.main.register_customer(customer: CustomerRegisterRequestSchema) → CustomerRegisterResponse¶

Registers a new customer.

Parameters:

customer (CustomerRegisterRequestSchema) – The customer registration details.

Returns:

Response object containing registration status and details.

Return type:

CustomerRegisterResponse

async app.main.update_customer(customer_id: str, updates: CustomerUpdateSchema)¶

Updates a customer’s information.

Parameters:

  • customer_id (str) – The ID of the customer to update.

  • updates (CustomerUpdateSchema) – The updates to apply to the customer.

Returns:

Response object containing update status and updated data.

Return type:

CustomerUpdateResponse

app.models module¶

class app.models.CustomerTable(url: str, key: str)¶

Bases: object

Handles database operations for customers and wallets.

Attributes:

client (Client): The Supabase client for database operations. table (SyncRequestBuilder): The customer table for database queries.

charge_wallet(user_id: str, amount: float) → list[Wallet] | None¶

Charges a customer’s wallet by adding a specified amount.

Parameters:

  • user_id (str) – The customer’s ID.

  • amount (float) – The amount to add to the wallet. Must be non-negative.

Returns:

The updated wallet details as a list, or None if an exception occurred.

Return type:

Optional[list[Wallet]]

Raises:

AssertionError – If the amount is not a float or is negative.

create_customer(customer: Customer) → bool | None¶

Creates a new customer and initializes their wallet.

Parameters:

customer (Customer) – The customer details.

Returns:

True if the customer and wallet were created successfully, False if the operation failed, or None if an exception occurred.

Return type:

Optional[bool]

deduct_wallet(user_id: str, amount: float) → list[Wallet] | None¶

Deducts a specified amount from a customer’s wallet.

Parameters:

  • user_id (str) – The customer’s ID.

  • amount (float) – The amount to deduct from the wallet. Must be negative.

Returns:

The updated wallet details as a list, or None if an exception occurred.

Return type:

Optional[list[Wallet]]

Raises:

AssertionError – If the amount is not a float or is not negative.

delete_user(user_id: str) → bool¶

Deletes a customer and their wallet.

Parameters:

user_id (str) – The customer’s ID.

Returns:

True if the user and wallet were deleted successfully, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

A list of customers, or None if an exception occurred.

Optional[list[Customer]]

Retrieves a specific user by their ID.

user_id (str) – The user’s unique ID.

Returns:

The user details as a list, or None if not found.

Return type:

Optional[list[Customer]]

get_users(**filters) → list[Customer] | None¶

Retrieves a list of users based on specified filters.

Parameters:

filters – Key-value pairs to filter users (e.g., role=”customer”).

Returns:

A list of matching users, or None if an exception occurred.

Return type:

Optional[list[Customer]]

user_id (str) – The customer’s ID.

The wallet details as a list, or None if an exception occurred.

Return type:

Optional[list[Wallet]]

update_user(user_id: str, new_customer: Customer) → list[Customer] | None¶

Updates the details of an existing customer.

Parameters:

  • user_id (str) – The ID of the customer to update.

  • new_customer (Customer) – The updated customer details, excluding the username.

Returns:

A list containing the updated customer details if successful, an empty list if the user is not found, or None if the update operation fails.

Return type:

Optional[list[Customer]]

update_wallet(user_id: str, amount: float) → list[Wallet] | None¶

Updates the wallet balance for a customer.

Parameters:

  • user_id (str) – The customer’s ID.

  • amount (float) – The amount to add (positive) or deduct (negative).

Returns:

The updated wallet details as a list, or None if an exception occurred.

Return type:

Optional[list[Wallet]]

app.schemas module¶

class app.schemas.BaseCustomResponse(status_code: int, message: str, data: Any | None = None, notes: str | None = None, errors: str | None = None)¶

Bases: JSONResponse

Base response class to handle shared logic for custom responses.

Parameters:

  • status_code (int) – The HTTP status code.

  • message (str) – A descriptive message about the response.

  • data (Optional[Any]) – The payload of the response, if any.

  • notes (Optional[str]) – Additional notes regarding the response.

  • errors (Optional[str]) – Error details, if any.

class app.schemas.Customer(*, name: str, username: str, password: str, age: Annotated[int, Ge(ge=0)], address: str, gender: bool, marital_status: Literal['single', 'married', 'divorced', 'widows'], role: Literal['customer', 'moderator', 'admin'])¶

Bases: BaseModel

Model representing a customer.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Full name of the customer.

  • username (str) – Unique username for the customer.

  • password (str) – Password for the customer account.

  • age (int) – Age of the customer (must be non-negative).

  • address (str) – Address of the customer.

  • gender (bool) – Gender of the customer (e.g., True for male, False for female).

  • marital_status (MaritalStatus) – Marital status of the customer.

  • role (CustomerRole) – Role of the customer (e.g., ‘customer’, ‘moderator’, ‘admin’).

class app.schemas.CustomerUpdateSchema(*, name: str | None = None, age: Annotated[int, Gt(gt=0)] | None = None, address: str | None = None, gender: bool | None = None, marital_status: Literal['single', 'married', 'divorced', 'widows'] | None = None)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Schema for updating customer information.

Parameters:

  • name (Optional[str]) – The new full name of the customer.

  • age (Optional[PositiveInt]) – The new age of the customer. Must be a positive integer.

  • address (Optional[str]) – The new physical address of the customer.

  • gender (Optional[bool]) – The new gender of the customer. True for male, False for female.

  • marital_status (Optional[MaritalStatus]) – The new marital status of the customer.

class app.schemas.WalletChargeResponse(status_code: int, customer_id: str, amount: float, new_balance: float | None = None, notes: str | None = None, errors: str | None = None)¶

Bases: BaseCustomResponse

Response for wallet charge operations.

Parameters:

  • status_code (int) – The HTTP status code of the response.

  • customer_id (str) – The ID of the customer whose wallet is being charged.

  • amount (float) – The amount being added to the wallet.

  • new_balance (Optional[float]) – The new wallet balance after the charge.

  • notes (Optional[str]) – Additional notes, if any.

  • errors (Optional[str]) – Error details, if any.

class app.schemas.WalletDeductResponse(status_code: int, customer_id: str, amount: float, new_balance: float | None = None, notes: str | None = None, errors: str | None = None)¶

Bases: BaseCustomResponse

Response for wallet deduction operations.

Parameters:

  • status_code (int) – The HTTP status code of the response.

  • customer_id (str) – The ID of the customer whose wallet is being deducted.

  • amount (float) – The amount being deducted from the wallet.

  • new_balance (Optional[float]) – The new wallet balance after the deduction.

  • notes (Optional[str]) – Additional notes, if any.

  • errors (Optional[str]) – Error details, if any.

app.utils module¶

app.utils.create_access_token(customer: Customer, expires_delta: timedelta = datetime.timedelta(seconds=3600)) → str¶

Create a JWT token for a Customer.

Parameters:

  • customer (Customer) – The customer object for which to create the token.

  • expires_delta (timedelta) – The token expiry duration (default is 1 hour).

Returns:

A JWT token as a string.

Return type:

str

app.utils.decode_access_token(token: str) → dict | str¶

Decode and verify a JWT token.

Parameters:

token (str) – The JWT token to decode.

Returns:

The payload as a dictionary if valid, or an error message if invalid.

Return type:

Union[dict, str]

app.utils.get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer)) → dict¶

Verify the JWT token and extract the current user’s information.

Parameters:

token (str) – The JWT token provided via the OAuth2 scheme.

Returns:

The decoded payload containing user information.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token has expired or is invalid.
